benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered: Valid Request: Happy path (TC01) verifies 200 and application/json response for a valid account and active tags.
Empty Response: TC06 covers accounts with no tags (empty JSON array).
Query Parameters: includedDeleted and audit query parameters are exercised (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) including combined usage (TC05).
Path parameter validation: invalid formats, partial UUID, empty and whitespace accountId edge cases are covered (TC08, TC20, TC21, TC22).
Error responses: 404 for non-existent account (TC07) and 400 for invalid accountId format (TC08) are covered.
Authorization: missing and invalid authentication tokens are tested (TC12, TC13 resulting in 401).
Security: input-sanitization checks are present (SQL injection TC14, XSS TC15).
Resilience / Integration errors: API unavailable and downstream failures are included (TC11 -> 503, TC24 -> 502).
Performance: large payload and concurrency scenarios are included (TC16, TC17).
Regression & compatibility: specific regression and legacy-client scenarios are present (TC18, TC19).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios exercise pagination (page/limit parameters, boundaries, or behaviour with large datasets).
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or conditional GETs (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests to validate rate limiting behavior or 429 responses under burst traffic.
Authorization scope/permissions: Tests cover missing/invalid tokens (401) but not forbidden scenarios (403) where a valid token lacks required permissions/roles.

Query-parameter validation gaps: No test for invalid includedDeleted values (e.g., includedDeleted=notabool) or malformed audit values beyond the single INVALID case (edge cases like lower-case "full", empty audit param, or repeated params).

Schema / field-level validation: Response Tag object shape and required fields (ids, tagDefinitionId, name, audit fields structure) aren’t asserted at field level — tests only assert "Tag objects" generically.
Server error 500: No explicit test simulating an internal server error (e.g., DB failure) returning 500.
Content negotiation / media types: No tests for unsupported Accept headers (406) or behavior when client requests non-JSON.
Rate-limiting vs concurrency distinction: TC17 addresses concurrency correctness/performance but not throttling or degraded behaviour under rate limits.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: exercise page/offset and limit parameters (first page, middle, last, page beyond end) and verify stable ordering and boundary conditions; include large dataset + pagination combination.
Add caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers on responses, test conditional GETs (If-None-Match -> 304) and freshness behaviors.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to verify 429 responses and backoff behavior; include tests for documented rate limits if available.
Add authorization-scope tests: include a valid token lacking permissions to assert 403 Forbidden and test role-based access if applicable.
Expand query-parameter validation: test invalid includedDeleted values (non-boolean), empty audit param, case-insensitive audit values, duplicate query params, and confirm correct 400 handling.
Add Tag schema assertions: assert required fields/types in each Tag object (e.g., id uuid, tagDefinitionId, name, audit info object when requested) rather than only asserting "Tag objects".
Add server-error simulation: test 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure/simulated exception) to confirm 500 handling and client-facing message.
Add content-negotiation tests: request non-JSON Accept headers and expect 406 or appropriate behavior; validate response Content-Type for all success/error cases.
Differentiate performance and throttling tests: keep TC17 for concurrency correctness but add dedicated throttling/rate-limit tests to cover 429 scenarios.
